nodes.bodyText:
this can be removed from here (the field too)
As soon as you do :stop-connector and :start-connector, this class keeps pointing to the old instance.
The metrics bytes read/written are never updated after the restart.
you need to get the Transport from the AbstractProtocolServer. The service, only keeps the first instance instantiated by the endpoint.
You need to get the Transport from the RestServer. Same reason as above.
the Transport is the "service" isn't needed anymore and can be removed.

just curious: you could have used a single class to handle the start and stop connector right? or it wouldn't work?
It seems the only difference is the method invoked :)
